items.title: No Construction Mess
items.content: Unlike replacements that require breaking through walls and creating construction debris, our product involves a simple pour-on application, eliminating odors and dust without the mess.

items.title: Time-Saving
items.content: The Refinishing process takes just 3-4 hours, compared to the 5-7 days needed for replacement, minimizing disruption to your daily routine.

items.title: Eco-Friendly
items.content: By refinishing your existing bathtub, you reduce waste and avoid the environmental impact. Environmentally friendly and safe for children and animals.

items.title: Durable Finish
items.content: Our product provides a high-quality, long-lasting finish that rejuvenates your tub's surface, ensuring it looks brand new.

faq.question: Are you insured?
faq.answer: Absolutely! Daniloff LLC is fully insured, so you can book our services with confidence.

faq.question: Do you work with property managers, hotels, or apartment complexes?
faq.answer: Yes! We specialize in working with property management companies, hotels, and apartment complexes to help them save on expensive bathtub replacements.

faq.question: Do you offer a warranty for your services?
faq.answer: Yes! We provide a 5-year warranty on all reglazing services.

faq.question: Whatâ€™s the difference between spray refinishing and liquid Armoglaze?
faq.answer: Unlike spray painting, which creates thin, flimsy coatings, our Armoglaze method creates a coating that is 10 times thicker, stronger and smoother, without runs or uneven spots.

faq.question: How soon can I use my bathtub after refinishing?
faq.answer: Your tub will be ready to use in just 24 hours after reglazing. The process itself only takes about 4 hours.

faq.question: Is bathtub refinishing safe and odor-free?
faq.answer: Yes! We use a non-toxic, odorless method that is safe for your home and health. Unlike traditional spray coatings, our process does not emit harmful fumes.

faq.question: How long does bathtub reglazing last?
faq.answer: Our Armoglaze refinishing lasts 15-20 years with proper care. It's much more durable than spray polishing.
